page.title: 04The Farm Today (Continued)
page.content: He told us though that most people in this area make silage as this is good food for both{dairy}and beef cattle. Also many people now grow fodderbeet for the same reasons. Mr Pleese has seen many changes in his 30 years of{farming.}The first is that milk used to be collected in churns but now is collected in tankers. Each of his cows produce 3 gallons per day. He only has 2 cows which produce{milk,}but altogether has 15. They check the milk weekly for diseases and it's also tested for T.B. This test is done once a year. If the animal shows any sign of containing the disease it is{slaughtered}and the government compensates the farmer. Now, because of all these tests you can drink milk safely straight from the cow. Milk is tested weekly for nutrition.
